Ray Tayek wrote:

> Hi, reading parts of junit recipes (*lots* of good stuff). I want to
> refactor a bunch of common tests into base test classes that follow one of
> my class hierarchies. But I need to enforce the order of the tests (I know
> it's not normal, but I am testing crud with dao's). It seems as soon as I
> use suite() to control the order, junit does not find the tests in the
> super-classes of that test case.
> 
> I am using the textui runner from main()in each base test case in eclipse.
> (but would like to be able to use different test runners, run the tests from
> ant etc.)

Eclipse's JUnit test runner doesn't handle certain suite() methods 
properly. I have a defect open for this. Search Eclipse's Bugzilla for 
details.

> Is there a way to do this so that it works regardless of the test runner and
> the environment?

Not when one environment's test runner has a defect that gets 
specifically in your way.

> Any pointers will be appreciated

If you need this feature, don't run your tests with Eclipse's test 
runner: use main() instead. Less good, but it works.
